nations.natDesc: The United States of America, also called the 'United States' or 'USA' for short, is a country located in North America and is bordered by Canada to the north and Mexico to the south.
Canada is the northern-most nation of the Americas. It sits on top of the USA, and is well-known for ice hockey, maple syrup, and bagged milk.
Mexico is the southern-most nation of North America. It is one of the largest and most notable Spanish-speaking countries in the entire world!
France is a major country in Europe and houses the Eiffel Tower in Paris, the captial of the nation and a popular tourist attraction!
Germany, officially the Federal Republic of Germany, is a country that is well known for Bratwurst, Lederhosen, and the iconic Oktoberfest!
The United Kingdom, often abbreviated to UK, is a nation separated from mainland Europe by the English Channel. The UK is a close ally of the United States!

nations.natSub: Country in Eastern Europe and North Asia
nations.natDesc: The Russian Federation is the largest nation on Earth, spanning across two different continents. It is home to several distinct ethnic groups.
China is the largest country in terms of population in East Asia, with over a billion people living there! The Great Wall of China, which is a popular tourist attraction, can be found there!
Japan is an island nation situated off the coast of East Asia. Many commercial products such as automobiles, electronics, and even video games are exported from here to the rest of the world!
South Korea is a small nation situated on the southern portion of the Korean Peninsula. Samsung, arguably the biggest competitior to Apple, is headquartered in Seoul, the capital city.
The Republic of India is the second most populous nation in the world, coming after China. Many different religions, cultures, and people can be found all throughout India!
Australia is not only a country, but a continent as well! Australia used to be a subject of the British Empire but have since become an independent nation of their own!
